text:
*[Bug 18792] QuartzBitmap_Output function seg_faults when filename is empty string*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18792>

Paul Murrell (<mailto:paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz|paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
     Ever confirmed|0                           |1
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |ASSIGNED
           Assignee|R-core@R-project.org        |paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz

--- Comment #3 from Paul Murrell (<mailto:paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz|paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz>) ---
Thanks Elin.  That does seem like a reasonable approach in this case.  

Of course no harm in having the additional defence against segfault in C code
as well.

text:
*[Bug 18333] incorrect output for pattern with text*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18333>

--- Comment #3 from Paul Murrell (<mailto:paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz|paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz>) ---
Thanks for the additional testing.

Unfortunately, I disagree that "wide and short DOES work".  The letters within
"test" are not widely spread in that case, but there is too much space around
the outside of the word.  If you push this a bit further, e.g., height = 1/4
width, you will see the letters of "test" being crushed together so that they
overwrite each other.

However, all of this does support the idea that transformations are at fault
here somehow.

elements.text: [Bug 18333] incorrect output for pattern with text

width, you will see the letters of "test" being crushed together so that they
overwrite each other.

However, all of this does support the idea that transformations are at fault
here somehow.
